email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out regarding your inquiry for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a suitable vessel, the MV Ocean Star, available for this route. She’s a 150,000 DWT Aframax with an LOA of 250 meters. The laycan is October 15-20. I’m quoting a freight rate in the low 50s, say $50.75 per metric ton. Let me know your thoughts. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the quick response. The vessel details look good, but the freight rate is a bit higher than we were hoping for. Could you come down to the mid-40s? Also, can you confirm the demurrage rate? Looking forward to your reply. Cheers, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. I understand your concerns on the rate. After discussing with the owner, we can offer $48.50 per metric ton, which I believe is competitive. The demurrage rate is $15,000 per day, pro rata. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, $48.50 sounds reasonable. We can proceed with that rate. However, we’d like to confirm the laycan remains October 15-20 and that the vessel will be ready to load on time. Also, please confirm the demurrage terms are pro rata. Thanks, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, great to hear that $48.50 works for you. Yes, the laycan remains October 15-20, and the vessel will be ready to load as agreed. Demurrage terms are indeed pro rata at $15,000 per day. I’ll send over the recap shortly for your review. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for confirming. Please proceed with the recap, and we’ll review it promptly. Looking forward to finalizing this. Cheers, John
